intro: Croton yangchunensis, commonly known as the Yangchun croton, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the genus Croton in the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful leaves that often display vibrant red, orange, and yellow hues. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and parks.
